summary:
Where do babies come from....Nowhere there are no babies in Skyrim

Challenge Accepted
descriptionHtml:
[center][b][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][i][color=#9bbb59][youtube]48aOAS69q3o[/youtube]

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/9193/?]Now available for Skyrim Special Edition[/url]


Baby Mommas, is an NPC/Immersion overhaul.

The goal of this mod is to further add to the illusion of Skyrim's life cycle:[/color][/i][/size][/font][/b][/center][center][b][color=#9bbb59][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][i][/i][/size][/font][/color][/b][/center][center][b][color=#9bbb59][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][i]Children[/i][/size][/font][/color][/b][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]Men[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]Women[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]Elders[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i][/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]
This was the order, then came [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57693/?]"Knocked Up"[/url], pregnant women were added to the mix.
But, this still left a major hole, this mod aims to fix that. [/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i][/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]
This mod will finally add babies to Skyrim, about 15 of them. [/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][b][color=#9bbb59][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][i]Five of them are children of existing Skyrim NPCs, the rest are divided between new NPCs
I've added, and of course Bandit/Forsworns NPCs. [/i][/size][/font][/color][/b][/center][center][b][color=#9bbb59][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][i][/i][/size][/font][/color][/b][/center][center][b][color=#9bbb59][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][i]
The NPCs which appear in Skyrim by default, have not been altered in any way, they still use their same AI packages, and function as they normally do. The new ones I've created, have AI packages added to them, so they will blend in more smoothly. The Bandit/Forsworn class NPCs, all have non-combative AI, so they will not engage you in combat, but they are not flagged as essential, if you are careless (or evil) they can be killed.[/i][/size][/font][/color][/b][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]You're probably wondering; How does this work, What does it really do?[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]So here's a brief overview.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]These "babies" are not NPCs, think of them as the birds or insects in Skyrim. [/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]They're there just for looks.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]I did this by adding their body meshes to their mothers clothes.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]So basiclly it looks like a woman carrying a newborn in her arms.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]By now you're thinking; OK this will look stupid and immersion breaking in game. [/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]Not really.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]I did this in a way which blends in very well with gameplay, animations are not added or altered,
so FNIS isn't required.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]Almost all animations work perfectly, even 90% of combat animations work very well... (but 90% isn't 100% that's why  the affect NPCs do not engage in combat, and why using this on PCs isn't intended) [/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]I can try to describe it, but it's not going to click until you see it yourself. [/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]Try it out, and enjoy.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#9bbb59][b][i]This mod is still a work in progress, so please report any bugs you find, and feel free to leave feedback/suggestions in the comments section.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#953734][b][i]Please endorse if you enjoy the mod. [/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#953734][b][i]credits:[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#953734][b][i]This mod contains assets used with permission:[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#953734][b][i]Baby blanket mesh by Milzschnitte the author of "Beeing Female"[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#953734][b][i]Barkeep Dress Texture by TwiggySkyrim[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center][center][font=Palatino Linotype][size=4][color=#953734][b][i]Thank you.[/i][/b][/color][/size][/font][/center]
author: Foster
